reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Sebo, Savas, Sukru, Bilge, Nimet, Little Ali, all contribute to a fabulous place to stay. This year we felt as if we'd come back to our own Villa. We met old friends and I'm sure some new ones that will be there next year when we go again. My previous reviews are still accurate.
reviews.title: It's like coming home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We last visited this property in September 2009 for one week. We enjoyed the service and the atmosphere so much that we visited again, this time for 2 weeks, in September 2012. Everything we loved about the hotel in 2009 was still there in 2012. All of the staff are lovely and seem to really enjoy working there. Egeman, the manager, speaks excellent English and is very keen to ensure that you are have a lovely holiday. Pumpkin, who runs the bar, also speaks excellent English and does an excellent job in running the bar and playing the music! The hotel is very sociable, with a number of guests gathering at the bar before and after dinner to catch up on the day's events. Whilst being sociable, it is not rowdy, just people on holiday having a good time.
reviews.title: 2nd visit - still a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a Superior Room (number 203) which we found to be a quiet room, with no noise from the hotel bar, just maybe a little road noise. A Superior Room more than met our needs after staying in a Deluxe Room on the previous visit.
reviews.title: Fantastic !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being travellers who do not normally visit the same place more than once, Kalkan has managed to draw us back on two occasions after our initial visit. I would have no hesitation in staying at The Elixir next time we visit Kalkan, whenever that may be!
reviews.title: Great Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Once again a lovely week at the Elixir. When it feels like 'coming home' you know you've found a great place! Previous reviewers have covered everything about this hotel from the management to the rooms, the facilities to the food etc etc etc. But it's the staff who make this hotel and the welcome you receive is second to none. So many guests are returning visitors and that says it all. Thanks to everyone there for a fantastic holiday. Can't wait to be back.
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited in September 2012 and were not disappointed. The manager runs a tight ship and he and all his staff work long hours to ensure their customers enjoy a good time. This was evidenced by the large proportion of returning visitors while we were there.
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited this hotel for 2 weeks in September 2013. It was our 3rd visit to the hotel, having been in 2012 and 2010. On all occasions we have booked through Anatolian Sky and found the service they provide to be excellent. The rep, Ahmet is excellent at his job and is always popping by the hotel to check all his guests are having a good holiday. We requested the same room as we had last year, room 203, a quiet room if you prefer this. The hotel will be 9 years old next year and whilst it is showing signs of age in the rooms this does not detract from the overall cleanliness and facilities provided. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace and there is a Turkish-style breakfast with the option of cooked eggs and fruit juice each morning. The pool is a lovely quiet area, with plenty of sunbeds, both in the sun and in the shade. Lunch can be taken around the pool and the menu is varied. However, what has drawn us back to the Elixir each time is the friendliness and genuine hospitality of the staff in the hotel, and the lovely people we meet around the bar each year. Savaz, Sami, Sebo, Ali and Bilge all deserve a special mention, but it is Pumpkin (or Sezai) who runs the bar that brings it all together. He is sociable, speaks excellent English and is at the heart of this small hotel. As in previous years, we met lovely fellow travellers during the course of our two weeks. Everyone is so friendly and willing to share recommendations for restaurants and day trips. This is what makes this holiday special. Kalkan is a special place, and the Elixir a special hotel. We will return one day I am sure. Thanks for another great holiday Elixir.
reviews.title: 3rd visit - still a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Claire & Alan George x
reviews.title: We have booked to come back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: We visited Kalkan and the Elixir Hotel for the first time for a two week holiday. We did not know what to expect as a brochure does always tell the real story. The resort is lovely and the hotel is a short 10 min walk to the town. We could not have found the staff to be more helpful and friendly, they created a welcoming and fun atmosphere!. The accommodation is lovely and the hotel is not too large. We met lovely people and Ali is such a great host and knows how to entertain the guests! The hotel truly is an Elixir! We have already booked to come back.
reviews.title: Lovely staff and atmosphere!
A great holiday
reviews.text: We visited kalkan for a two week holiday and although we stayed in a Villa we visited The Elixir almost every evening. There is a lovely friendly atmosphere and the staff make you feel very welcome. Even though we were not staying at The Elixir the staff did their upmost to make our stay enjoyable, in particular Ali. Complementary crips, nuts, chocolate and fruit were brought to our table every visit and Ali's Sex on the Beach is the best cocktail iv ever tasted and well worth the money! Ali even made the effort to play pool with us and had a drink with us on our last night! Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Kalkan and we will definitely be returning on our next visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week's holiday at this hotel and had a fantastic time. All of the staff are helpful and welcoming. Our room was comfortable although the balcony small but we did not tend to use this as every evening we would spend time with other guests at the hotel pool bar. This is run by "Pumpkin" who makes all the guests feel like they are the most important people there. It is mainly due to him that we will return to this hotel in the future.
reviews.title: Fantastic
Gorgeous holiday
reviews.text: Just spent a lovely relaxing week at The Elixir and had an absolutely wonderful time. Whoever says differently is just terribly fussy!

We had a fantastic Turkish bath at the hotel and the team there are full of advice of where to go and seem genuinely interested in your stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: When we arrived at the Elixir we were greeted by warm welcoming smiles. Ali, Selda and co are the perfect hosts they make you feel like you are visting friends rather than a hotel. Our room was clean and very comfortable. The pool was excellent, and the bar always entertaining whatever time of the day or night. One week at the Elixir was not enough. reviews.title: Doesnt live up to the reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited this hotel in September 2012 and thought it was fantastic. It is in a great location (about a 10 minute walk from the centre of town). We had a superior room, it was spacious and nicely decorated. The bathroom was a good size, with a nice bath/shower. The staff are probably the best thing about this hotel, everyone was very friendly, welcoming and willing to go the extra mile (eg making late night snacks for us when our plane landed later than expected). The bar is the focal point of the hotel and is good for pre-dinner/after dinner drinks. The pool area is lovely, lots of good quality sun loungers and a well stocked library of books. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace and there is a reasonable selection (cereals, fruit, yoghurt, bread, cheese etc). We ate lunch at the hotel most days, the food was very good, a nice selection and big portions. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel
A spot of calm and rejuvenation
reviews.text: This is my 3rd stay at The Elixir and probably will not be my last. My partner and I come here to chill, de-stress and rejuvenate ourselves before returning to our hectic work schedules. There are many strong points this hotel has, hence our returning to it. The location is perfect, 20 minutes walk out of the town but surrounded by coffee shops, restaurants and small supermarkets if you didn't want the hilly walk.

reviews.title: Another fabulous time :)
reviews.text: The size of the hotel means that you are away from the crowds and can be left to enjoy the peace and quiet and/or make friends with like minded folk. The pool area is very relaxing and the pool itself can house a quick dip to cool off or you can swim several lengths to work off the varied and ample breakfasts. Cold beer with a large size luncheon can be taken round the pool area at your leisure.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The big plus is that the surrounding area offers many cool, shaded areas, comfy sofas by the bar, a quiet garden area and a shaded dining area. There is always somewhere to sit and snooze or read.
reviews.title: Lovely staff but hotel "tired"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the things we really like is that the same staff are there each year, which is a real positive thing and they all seem to remember you and are very, very friendly. The manager Eggerman welcomes all guests and is also there to bid you farewell on your journey home, this is a real nice touch.
reviews.title: Not a 'Boutique' hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: excellent hotel, mixed age range, super friendly staff, this is the first hotel I really felt at home, the bar is brill with an extrovert barman, had great fun every evening , rooms a little small but didn't mind as we didn't stay in our room, the manager is top class was even at breakfast supervising, it felt like a 5 star hotel!! will defiantly go back , Kalkan 5 mins walk, really no problem. I read other reviews saying negative things but this is my 3rd trip to kalkan and this was by far the best experience i have ever had, great also for singles, really friendly crowd when we stayed there. I recomend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great holiday, top class hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 4 of us stayed here (2 couples) and had a wonderful time, thankyou to all staff who made our stay what it was, the cleaners for decorating our room with petals when it was my husbands 50th birthday and making our room spotless to come back to, (We stayed in the superior rooms which I gather from talking to other guests were much larger than the standard, had a small fridge and armchairs in and were spacious rooms) with lovely modern bathrooms) the reception staff for their unfailing help and welcoming smiles, gardener for the lovely grounds to relax in, chefs and waiters for the delicious food and bar staff for serving endless drinks and chatting to us. We were asked each day by the manager if things were OK and who made sure we were enjoying ourselves. I will not mention individual names, there are enough in other reviews but just want to say a big thankyou to everyone, seen and unseen. I am sure there are many behind the scenes who do not get mentioned and work hard.
reviews.title: Staff make it all worthwhile
Not a 4 star hotel but lovely Staff
reviews.text: The restaurant on top floor is worth going to as food delicious and fab view - this is also where breakfast is served, eggs any style, cereals, turkish breakfast, fruit, yoghurts.

reviews.title: Great chill out hotel
reviews.text: Pool is not huge but great for cooling off, we had no problem getting sunbeds but did notice towards end of hol that it did get busier around pool as season kicked in- usual annoying trick of people putting towels on sun beds and then not appearing until after lunch time! In the first week there were other days when we literally had pool to the 4 of us when the trips were on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Walk downhill to town about 15/20 mins,dolmush passes hotel and costs 2.5 TL each so if 2 of you fine, but a taxi backwas only 11 TL (about £5)so if 4/5 of you just as cheap to get taxi. Walk back was energetic but was the only exercise we got all week although did sucumb to lure of taxi at the end of a long wonderful day at Mahal beach club.
reviews.title: Dedicated staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Please, please think very carefully before you book this hotel, this is definitely not a 4 star establishment more like a 2 star, and is only boutique in the sense that it is small, there is nothing stylish at all about this place. The service is poor, the management are both rude and extremely lazy . The waiters are not at all competent and have little/no experience, they did not seem to know what they were doing and kept getting breakfasts orders completely wrong, together with us being kept waiting too long for tea/coffee orders, this was not acceptable . Speaking of breakfast, which is extremely basic, nothing on displayed was chilled, the butter was melting in the heat and you are charged extra for fresh orange juice . The receptionist did not smile once during our holiday. The drink and food prices are outrageously expensive, when we had drinks at the bar we were never served nuts, olives etc . You are not allowed to bring water in to the hotel, the hotel charges 3.50 YTL for a bottle! Whilst we appreciate this is common practice in Turkey, what the hotel was charging was a rip off. If you are unfortunate enough to have already have booked, we would recommend the Cafe Vita for lunch which is just down the road towards Kalamar Bay, the times we went there most of the hotel guests were lunching there!!!, as the prices are so expensive in the hotel and the quality not good enough for what you are paying . Once the management realised that we were not spending any money in the hotel their attitude to us completely changed to the extent that they were rude.
reviews.title: This is not Turkish Delight

likes.disliked: — leaving knowing I would never have to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Finally, do not go there if you are an animal lover – the manager has a dog which on quite a few occasions was tied up (on a far too short lead) whilst in the shade the temperatures were in the forties. The dog had no clean water and the food that had been put out for him was disgusting, if we were at home I would have phoned the RSPCA straight away, whilst we did report this to the rep, the dog was removed and was not tied up in the same place again during our stay. It was an extremely upsetting.
reviews.title: Loved The Elixir
